edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configuration
Class FrameData

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configuration.FrameData

public class FrameData
extends java.lang.Object

Defines the data contents of a configuration frame. Provides methods for accessing and setting configuration frame data. Frame data is stored as an array of ints. TODO - Need methods for initializing the contents of the frame data and make them safe.

          This is a list of all the words in a frame

Constructor Detail

FrameData

public FrameData(int size)
The frame is initialized to zero with size number of 32-bit words. All frames in a given device should be the same size.

Parameters:
size - The size of the frame in 32-bit words.

zeroData

public void zeroData()
Sets all parameters and data to zero. The frame looks freshly initialized.

XORDATA

public boolean XORDATA(FrameData f)
XORs the data words of this frame with those of Frame f and stores them in this frame. Sets hasData appropriately.

Parameters:
f - The frame containing the data to be XOR'ed with this frame
Returns:
true if the operation succeeds, false otherwise.

ANDData

public boolean ANDData(FrameData f)
ANDs the data words of this frame with those of Frame f and stores them in this frame. Sets hasData appropriately.

Parameters:
f - The frame containing the data to be AND'ed with this frame
Returns:
true if the operation succeeds, false otherwise.

ORData

public boolean ORData(FrameData f)
ORs the data words of this frame with those of Frame f and stores them in this frame. Sets hasData appropriately.

Parameters:
f - The frame containing the data to be OR'ed with this frame
Returns:
true if the operation succeeds, false otherwise.

MASKData

public boolean MASKData(FrameData f)
Zeros out data in this FrameData that are "ones" in f. This is used for mask bitfiles.

Parameters:
f - The frame containing the data to be MASK'ed with this frame
Returns:
true if the operation succeeds, false otherwise.

NOTData

public void NOTData()
Inverts the data words stored in the frame.

setBit

public boolean setBit(int index,
                      int value)
Sets the bit in the frameData at index with value.

Parameters:
index - Bit index into the frame of the desired bit to set.
value - The value (0 or 1) of the bit.
Returns:
true if operation was successful, false otherwise.

flipBit

public boolean flipBit(int index)
Flips the bit (0->1 or 1->0) at the bit index specified

Parameters:
index - The bit index of the bit to be flipped
Returns:
true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

isEqual

public boolean isEqual(FrameData f)
Checks if two frames sizes and data words are equal. It doesn't check for other aspects of the frame (tagged, mustWrite, or hasData) are equal, just size and data.

Parameters:
f - The frame to check this frame's data words against.
Returns:
true if the data words and size of this frame and Frame f are equal, false otherwise.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Determines if the frame data is empty (i.e. all words are zero)

Returns:
true if all words are zero, false otherwise

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Generate a String representing the full contents of the Frame.
